sub_title: Professor, Research chair in 'Earth Structure and Dynamics and head of department of Applied Earth Sciences
summary:
Mark van der Meijde has an MSc degree in earth sciences from Utrecht University (1998) and a PhD in geophysics from the ETH Zurich, Switzerland (2003). In the past, he worked at the Dutch Seismological Institute (KNMI) and the Dutch geological survey (NITG-TNO). Since 2015, he is Professor on 'Earth structure and dynamics' in ITC's department of Earth Systems Analysis where he started working in 2003. 
His main research interest is the making the link between remotely sensed surface and subsurface information. Fields of application focus on seismology for earth structure and dynamics, the integration with (space- or airborne) geophysics, 3D geological modelling, integrating space and airborne (hyperspectral) remote sensing with seismology for geo-hazards and tectonics, and 3D environmental modelling, particularly focussing on detection of natural and man-made hydrocarbon leakages.

'description': 'PhD in geophysics: “Crust and upper mantle structure in the Mediterranean region derived from receiver function analysis”. I obtained detailed information on the 2D and 3D Earth structure from modelling of the amplitude and relative timing of direct and multiple P-to-S converted waves at velocity contrasts. One major result was the first seismic evidence of the presence of water deep in Earth’s mantle. My work included testing and installation of 2 international seismic networks, and developing and programming the processing and archiving scheme of the recorded data.\nIn the last few months worked on the implementation and online accessibility of 3D geophysical models through internet.', 'title': 'researcher', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 3614, 'name': 'NITG-TNO', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQFobKDECbgbEQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1688455653111?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=ho1ffvJJOaiufyZS54sM9jND_CnKpQ7s15LCXPTNO0Q', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/tno/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 1998}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 1999}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Delft, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 1998}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 1999}}, 'company': 'TNO', 'description': 'working on 3D shallow subsurface characterization using, among others, GPR, MASW, reflection seismics, TDEM', 'title': 'researcher', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 21225, 'name': 'KNMI', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQHcggurhlwZsg/company-logo_400_400/0/1519856367173?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=zmF1oVE45HUcI6W_39itbe3YH7byr-0FpNM8smJ8T40', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/knmi/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 1997}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 1998}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'De Bilt, Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 1997}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 1998}}, 'company': 'KNMI - Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute', 'description': 'working on probabilistic seismic hazard analysis studies, especially on the sensitivity of seismic zonation for the overall seismic hazard calculations.', 'title': 'researcher', 'employment_type': None}]}]
